title: [solved] 820-3115 no backlight after liquid damage
message:
The board was liquid damaged 

I wasn't getting voltage at the fuse, replaced U9701 and got voltage. Now it appears the circuit is not being boosted to drive the backlight. 
I also replaced 0910


I'm getting 14.3V on PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT on the LVDS connector but no backlight. 
I'm guessing there is no boost?
Diode mode measurement on PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT is 0.608
SW via is blown?
How do check the SW traces?

title: [solved] 820-3115 no backlight after liquid damage
message: You have teeny tiny kinda sorta boost. What voltage do you get on BKL_PWM? If you shove PP3V3_S0 on BKL_PWM, do you have backlight? Actually, let's not get ahead here, answer question #1 first before question #2 :)

title: [solved] 820-3115 no backlight after liquid damage
message:
This is odd. BKL_EN 2.7v? 

You check the SW trace by removing the LP8550 and testing continuity of the two switch pads to pin 2 of L9701. It sucks, a waste of an lp8550. :( 

but that shouldn't cause this low 14.3v. Is it consistent 14.3v, or is it a spike that then slowly diminishes to 1.2v over time? The latter can mean issue between Q9706 and L9701 - this is a common path to corrode, and that is what will happen when the via inside the board blows.

Keep the meter there and tell me if it is a consistent 14.3v on backlight output, and also, BKL_EN voltage please! :)

title: [solved] 820-3115 no backlight after liquid damage
message:
3.1V on BKL_EN (measured on R9715 and R9731)

I am now getting 12.53V on PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT

title: [solved] 820-3115 no backlight after liquid damage
message:
Removed the LP8550, I have continuity from PPBUS_SW_LCDBKLT_PWR_SW (pin 6 and 7) to pin L9701. 
Does that mean the SW trace is good?

title: [solved] 820-3115 no backlight after liquid damage
message: Yes, trace is ok... check continuity between pin 5 and cathode of D9701...

title: [solved] 820-3115 no backlight after liquid damage
message:
What aprendiz said. Next is feedback missing. 

12.6v means no boosting.No break in the line, but no boosting. 

It would help to see what this looks like.

title: [solved] 820-3115 no backlight after liquid damage
message:
I have continuity between Pin 5 and D9701. 
Is it possible that I did a bad job replacing the LP8550?

title: [solved] 820-3115 no backlight after liquid damage
message:
I replaced the LP8550 again, and the backlight works!
Thanks for all the help guys

title: [solved] 820-3115 no backlight after liquid damage
message: Push the chip down onto the board hard before applying heat,to make sure it is pressed on all the right pads. If it is floating on one side it won't go on properly. Using flux?

title: [solved] 820-3115 no backlight after liquid damage
message:
Yes, using Amtech 559. I removed the LP8550 yesterday and replaced it and the problem was solved. Backlight now works! I'm waiting on a 4mm nozzle for the my Weller WHA900. Reflow with Chinese air stations sucks! 

Thanks Louis and aprendiz!

title: [solved] 820-3115 no backlight after liquid damage
message:
I'm gonna close this before duke says what he uses as a hot air station and you guys get any ideas. :p ;)

I'm glad this worked!!
